translation.en: [man] What do you think?
translation.ja: どう思います？

translation.en: I think that the law, as it relates to mandatory reporting, is pretty clear
translation.ja: 報告義務に関する法律は とても明確です

translation.en: that you should err on the side of the child
translation.ja: 児童虐待の申し立は―

translation.en: and report allegations to authorities immediately. That's what the law says.
translation.ja: 直ちに当局に 報告しなければなりません

translation.en: [Evans] As we looked deeper into Maggie Nichols' story,
translation.ja: マギーの件を調べていると

translation.en: we got a large dump of documents from one of our colleagues in Lansing, Michigan.
translation.ja: ミシガンの同僚から 書類が送られてきました

translation.en: And there were hundreds of pages, including a half dozen or so e-mails.
translation.ja: ものすごい量の書類でしたよ

translation.en: This is a July 22, 2015 e-mail.
translation.ja: 2015年７月22日のメールだ

translation.en: So this was after Maggie had reported to USA Gymnastics.
translation.ja: マギーが連盟に 訴えたあとのものだね

translation.en: Records that we reviewed showed that one e-mail was sent to USA Gymnastics' attorney.
translation.ja: “連盟の弁護士宛てに メールが送られている”

translation.en: Nassar had shared links to some graphic videos
translation.ja: “ナサール医師は 自らの潔白を示めそうと―”

translation.en: of him performing what he deemed were medical procedures
translation.ja: “ナサール医師は 自らの潔白を示めそうと―” “治療行為だと主張する 動画を弁護士に見せた”

translation.en: to defend himself from allegations of abuse.
translation.ja: “治療行為だと主張する 動画を弁護士に見せた”

translation.en: Once you find the tender point, you can stay on it.
translation.ja: 痛かったら じっとしてて

translation.en: [Evans] I think anybody that saw that and was a reasonable person
translation.ja: 普通 あの動画を見たら―

translation.en: and cared about kids would have taken some action immediately.
translation.ja: すぐ行動を起こすはずです

translation.en: And there were other e-mails between Nassar
translation.ja: 〝ナサール医師が 送ったメール〞 連盟関係者に宛てられた メールもありました 連盟関係者に宛てられた メールもありました 連盟関係者に宛てられた メールもありました 〝ライバキ氏及び マルタ宛て〞

translation.en: and a couple of USA Gymnastics officials.
translation.ja: 連盟関係者に宛てられた メールもありました 〝ライバキ氏及び マルタ宛て〞

translation.en: Pretty soon, we're fishing those out and looking at this timeline we've created
translation.ja: こうした情報を 時系列に並べると―

translation.en: of, you know, these lies they were telling to cover for him.
translation.ja: 連盟のうそは明らかです

translation.en: And it says, "We explained on the call, USA Gymnastics has been made aware of concerns regarding some of your therapy techniques
translation.ja: “治療中 体に触るなど 不適切な行為があることを”

translation.en: and that athletes aren't comfortable with certain areas of their body that are being treated."
translation.ja: “連盟側は 報告を受け認識していた”

translation.en: [Kwiatkowski] "In addition, we suggest, prior to the championships, that Ron Galimore will once again advise the medical staff,
translation.ja: “ナサール医師の 大会不参加の理由は”

translation.en: the athlete care coordinator, that you cannot attend for personal reasons,
translation.ja: “個人的な 理由ということにしよう”

translation.en: unless you prefer a different approach that we are prepared to discuss."
translation.ja: “他の案があれば また検討する”

translation.en: All right. All right, thank you. Bye.
translation.ja: 分かった　ありがとう

translation.en: So tell me what the-- What's the headline? What's the lede?
translation.ja: 見出しはどうする？ 主張は？

translation.en: USA Gymnastics, in negotiating, basically, with Larry,
translation.ja: ナサール医師は 連盟と話し合って

translation.en: agreed to lie to people and say that he was sick,
translation.ja: 病気だとうそをついた 病気だとうそをついた 〝理由は 体調不良にしたい〞

translation.en: and that's why he couldn't go to a particular competition.
translation.ja: 〝理由は 体調不良にしたい〞 それで大会に参加してない

translation.en: -[Berta] Mm-hmm. -So that... I mean, that shows a cover-up.
translation.ja: 彼をかばったのよ

translation.en: It's a pretty good story.
translation.ja: そうだな

translation.en: How many co-- were copied on the e-mail?
translation.ja: このメールの受信者は？

translation.en: Three. It was Larry, Rybacki, and Karolyi.
translation.ja: ナサール医師 ライバキ氏 カローリ氏の３人

translation.en: [woman] Since the initial allegations became public this month,
translation.ja: 性的暴行疑惑が 報道されて以降―

translation.en: the Michigan State University police have received two dozen complaints of sexual abuse against Nassar.
translation.ja: ミシガン州立大学警察署には 相当数の告発文が殺到

translation.en: As the complaints came in this month, Nassar was fired from MSU,
translation.ja: これを受けてナサール医師は 解雇されましたが

translation.en: but he has not been charged with a crime.
translation.ja: 罪には問われていません 罪には問われていません 〝ミシガン州立大学〞

translation.en: [Denhollander] The two biggest fears I had coming forward was the investigator that I would get and the prosecutor,
translation.ja: 捜査官や検察官のことが 最も気がかりでした

translation.en: because both of them are capable of completely derailing the process
translation.ja: きちんと捜査し 罪を問うかどうか―

translation.en: if they don't take it seriously, don't investigate it well, and if they choose not to file charges.
translation.ja: それを握っているのは 彼らですからね

translation.en: [woman] John Manly filed the civil lawsuits
translation.ja: ミシガン州ランジング マンリー弁護士は― マンリー弁護士は―

translation.en: against Michigan State and USAG, USOC.
translation.ja: ミシガン州と連盟及び ＵＳＯＣに対し

translation.en: And he represented those victims in their civil litigation.
translation.ja: 民事訴訟を起こしました

translation.en: I played the role of the lead prosecutor in the criminal case
translation.ja: アンジェラ･ ポビライティス 私はナサール医師の 裁判において― 私はナサール医師の 裁判において― 私はナサール医師の 裁判において― ミシガン州司法次官補

translation.en: of the People of the State of Michigan v. Larry Nassar
translation.ja: ミシガン州司法次官補 ミシガン州司法次官補 主席検事を務めました

translation.en: and, um, worked with and represented, um, those victims in court as the prosecutor.
translation.ja: 主席検事を務めました 被害者を代表し 申し立てを行ったのです

translation.en: [Denhollander] Andrea and Angela worked very closely together.
translation.ja: アンジェラは書類を見て―

translation.en: And Angela looked at the files, and she said...
translation.ja: こう言ってくれました

translation.en: "I will take them all, and I will fight for every one of them." And she did.
translation.ja: “全て引き受けて 被害者のために戦う”とね

translation.en: This is a neighborhood in Holt, Michigan.
translation.ja: 大学から近いこの辺りに―

translation.en: It's not far from MSU's campus, um, where he lived.
translation.ja: ナサール医師は 住んでいました

translation.en: And we had gotten information from some victims
translation.ja: ある被害者からの話では―

translation.en: that reported he was doing medical treatments in the basement of his home.
translation.ja: 彼は自宅の地下室でも 治療をしていたそうです

translation.en: And, during that time, he was sexually abusing them.
translation.ja: そこでも暴行は行われ―

translation.en: Um, there was also another victim who was not a medical patient that he had sexually abused in the basement.
translation.ja: 患者でない人も 被害を受けたと聞いています

translation.en: And based on that information, we were able to get search warrants for his house.
translation.ja: そうした情報を元に 家宅捜索が認められました

translation.en: We executed the search warrant on September 20th, 2016.
translation.ja: 許可が下りたのは 2016年９月20日でした

translation.en: One of our crime scene investigators came in midday
translation.ja: 昼頃 現場に向かうと ある捜査員が―

translation.en: and said, "The trash hasn't been picked up yet. It's still out by the curb, and all the trash is still in it."
translation.ja: ごみが回収前だということに 気が付いたんです

translation.en: So we did what's called a trash pull.
translation.ja: それで中を調べました

translation.en: Inside the trash, there were several hard drives...
translation.ja: 数枚のディスクがあり―

translation.en: with his name and phone number written on them in Sharpie.
translation.ja: 彼の名前と電話番号が 書かれてありました

translation.en: That's where the first images of child sexually abusive material...
translation.ja: それは子供への暴行を 示唆するような―

translation.en: commonly referred to as child porn, were found.
translation.ja: 児童ポルノでした

translation.en: Thirty-seven thousand images.
translation.ja: 〝ミシガン州立大学 警察署〞 ３万7000枚もありました

translation.en: [woman] Michigan State University and Team USA Gymnastics doctor,
translation.ja: アメリカ女子体操の チームドクターが

translation.en: Larry Nassar, has been arrested.
translation.ja: アメリカ女子体操の チームドクターが 逮捕されました

translation.en: Nassar will be charged with three counts of first-degree criminal sexual conduct
translation.ja: 13歳未満の子供に対する 第一級性犯罪を

translation.en: with someone younger than 13. Attorney General Bill Schuette is...
translation.ja: 問われています 弁護士によると…

translation.en: [Povilaitis] We were looking toward trial, um, and preparing for that.
translation.ja: 彼が一番重い罪で 裁かれるよう―

translation.en: And... and we really looked at what could get the highest sentence for him.
translation.ja: 私たちは準備を進めました

translation.en: In Michigan, we have a statute that, if you have a victim under 13
translation.ja: ミシガンでは 13歳未満の子の場合― 強制的な最低刑罰25年が 科されます

translation.en: and she's penetrated, it's a 25-year mandatory minimum.
translation.ja: 強制的な最低刑罰25年が 科されます

translation.en: And then we identified those cases that we thought were strongest and brought those in February of 2017.
translation.ja: だからそうした事件を 持ち込んだんです

translation.en: Those victims knew to report because of Rachael's disclosure.
translation.ja: その当時はまだ 世間に公表していたのは―

translation.en: She, you know, at that point, was the only public face.
translation.ja: レイチェルだけでした

translation.en: [Munford] When a victim comes to report a sexual assault, it's a scary thing
translation.ja: 被害者が性的暴行に関して

translation.en: because they're giving up so much control by telling someone what happened to them.
translation.ja: 裁判で詳細を語るのは 勇気がいります

translation.en: But each of the survivors were very determined...
translation.ja: ですが彼女たちは決心して―

translation.en: to make it very clear to everybody...
translation.ja: 明確に語ってくれました

translation.en: what really went on.
translation.ja: 真実をね

translation.en: [Manly] What ended up happening is he made a plea deal...
translation.ja: ナサール医師は 司法取引に応じ―

translation.en: where he agreed to plead guilty to the possession of child pornography,
translation.ja: いくつかの罪を認めました

translation.en: to willfully destroying evidence...
translation.ja: 児童ポルノ所有や 証拠隠滅などの罪です

translation.en: and a couple of other charges, in exchange for the dismissal
translation.ja: 児童ポルノ所有や 証拠隠滅などの罪です また性的暴行目的の 海外渡航をしないことにも―

translation.en: of traveling with intent to commit a sexual assault overseas,
translation.ja: また性的暴行目的の 海外渡航をしないことにも―

translation.en: which is a violation of federal law.
translation.ja: 同意しました

translation.en: [Povilaitis] Good morning, Your Honor. Angela Povilaitis.
translation.ja: アンジェラ･ ポビライティスです

translation.en: On behalf of the people and the Michigan Department of Attorney General,
translation.ja: ミシガン州検事総長を 代表し―

translation.en: I will let the other attorneys--
translation.ja: これから…

translation.en: We were able to lay out the terms of the sentencing range.
translation.ja: 量刑に関しては明確でした

translation.en: But we also wanted victim buy-in. Like, we wanted them,
translation.ja: そして証言に関しても―

translation.en: all 125, if possible, to be okay with this plea.
translation.ja: 125人全員の同意を得たいと 思っていました

translation.en: So essential to any plea agreement
translation.ja: 罪状の申し立てにおいては 基本的に―

translation.en: was that he had to agree to allow all of the victims,
translation.ja: 罪状の申し立てにおいては 基本的に― 被害者は被告と対面して 証言しなければなりません

translation.en: if they chose, to give an impact statement.
translation.ja: 被害者は被告と対面して 証言しなければなりません

translation.en: So that was something, quite frankly, I am really proud about.
translation.ja: これは すごいことですよ

translation.en: If I may, our first survivor to speak today, Your Honor,
translation.ja: 今日最初に 証言してくれるのは

translation.en: is a former, um, national team member, and I'm very happy that she's here. Her name is Jamie Dantzscher.
translation.ja: 元代表選手のジェイミー･ ダンツスチャーです

translation.en: [judge] Thank you. What would you like us to know?
translation.ja: どうそお話ください

translation.en: Larry, you saw all the physical, mental, and emotional abuse
translation.ja: コーチや連盟関係者による 身体的 精神的な虐待を

translation.en: from our coaches and USAG national staff.
translation.ja: あなたは傍観してきました

translation.en: You pretended to be on my side, calling all of them the monsters.
translation.ja: 私たちの 味方のふりをしながら―

translation.en: But instead of protecting children and reporting the abuse you saw...
translation.ja: 守ってくれず 虐待の報告もしませんでした

translation.en: you used your position of power to manipulate and abuse as well.
translation.ja: そして自分の立場を利用し 暴行を犯しました

translation.en: You knew I was powerless.
translation.ja: 無力な私たちに

translation.en: I'm here today with all these other women, not victims, but survivors...
translation.ja: ここにいる女性たちは 犠牲者ではありません

translation.en: to tell you face-to-face that your days of manipulation are over.
translation.ja: 勇気をもってあなたの悪事を 終わらせにきました

translation.en: We have a voice now.
translation.ja: 今 私たちには声も―

translation.en: We have the power now.
translation.ja: 力もあるのです

translation.en: As an Olympic gymnast...
translation.ja: 元オリンピック代表として―

translation.en: being able to say...
translation.ja: 伝えることができました

translation.en: "You have no power over me anymore..."
translation.ja: “もう操られない”と

translation.en: I can finally say I am proud to be an Olympian.
translation.ja: やっと自分を オリンピアンだと思えます

translation.en: It's been so hard to be... proud of anything.
translation.ja: 今までは 何も誇れませんでした

translation.en: So to even say that, for me, is like, "Okay.
translation.ja: やっと前に進めそうです

translation.en: I think I'm getting a little better. I feel proud of something."
translation.ja: 変われそうな気がしています

translation.en: [Povilaitis] Judge, the first victim will be publicly identified, and her name is Ms. Kyle Stephens.
translation.ja: カイル･スティーブンスが 実名で証言します

translation.en: She has asked for two support persons. I will be standing in support of her.
translation.ja: 彼女の依頼により 私が付添人を…

translation.en: The next survivor you will hear from is Amanda Thomashow.
translation.ja: アマンダ･トマショフです

translation.en: She has authorized to be publicly identified.
translation.ja: 彼女は実名で証言します

translation.en: Your Honor, the next survivor you will hear from is Larissa Boyce.
translation.ja: 続いてはラリーサ･ボイス

translation.en: She is going to be publicly identified.
translation.ja: 実名で証言を行います

translation.en: I told Michigan State University back in 1997.
translation.ja: ミシガン州立大学に 告発したのは1997年です

translation.en: Instead of being protected... I was humiliated, I was in trouble,
translation.ja: 守られるどころか 私は問題児扱いされ―

translation.en: and brainwashed into believing that I was the problem.
translation.ja: 自分が間違っていると 洗脳されました

translation.en: Every time Angela stood up and said, "Survivor XYZ is coming forward, and she has decided to speak publicly..."
translation.ja: 被害者は実名で証言すると アンジェラが宣言する度―

translation.en: that was just an incredibly powerful statement every single time.
translation.ja: とても力強さを感じました

translation.en: Because it meant that they felt safe enough.
translation.ja: なぜならそれは―

translation.en: And it meant that they were able to put the shame not on themselves, but on their abuser.
translation.ja: 恥ずべき人間は彼だと 宣言したも同然だからです

translation.en: [woman] Olympic gold medalist Simone Biles is going public today,
translation.ja: 金メダリストの シモーネ･バイルズが

translation.en: saying she was among the athletes who were sexually abused by Larry Nassar.
translation.ja: ナサール医師による 性的暴行を証言する予定です

translation.en: [man] Several Olympic champions have also come forward,
translation.ja: その他にも アリー･レイズマン

translation.en: including Aly Raisman, McKayla Maroney and Gabby Douglas.
translation.ja: マッケイラ･マロニーや ギャビー･ダグラスがいます

translation.en: Maggie Nichols first came forward more than two years ago,
translation.ja: マギー･ニコルズは 約２年前に―

translation.en: but her identity has not been publicly known until now.
translation.ja: 告発していたことが 明らかになりました

translation.en: [Gina] Maggie did not want to be here today.
translation.ja: マギーは大学生で―

translation.en: She is a full-time student, and she's training as a full-time athlete still for the University of Oklahoma.
translation.ja: 選手として練習があるため 今日は来ていません

translation.en: So this is-- It's too painful.
translation.ja: とてもつらいですが…

translation.en: So I'm gonna read, um, the statement from-- that she put out to the public.
translation.ja: 彼女が公表する証言書を 代読します

translation.en: "USA Gymnastics and the United States Olympic Committee
translation.ja: “米国体操連盟及び ＵＳＯＣは選手に―”

translation.en: did not provide a safe environment
translation.ja: “米国体操連盟及び ＵＳＯＣは選手に―” “安全な環境を 提供していません”

translation.en: for me and my teammates and friends to train.
translation.ja: “安全な環境を 提供していません”

translation.en: We were subjected to Dr. Larry Nassar at every national team training camp,
translation.ja: “毎月行われる合宿には ナサール医師が”

translation.en: which occurred monthly at the Karolyi Ranch.
translation.ja: “いつも同行していました”

translation.en: Up until now, I was identified as Athlete A
translation.ja: “私は連盟やＵＳＯＣ ミシガン州立大学から”

translation.en: by USA Gymnastics, the United States Olympic Committee, and Michigan State University.
translation.ja: “今まで“アスリートＡ”と 呼ばれてきました”

translation.en: And I want everyone to know that he did not do this to Athlete A.
translation.ja: “彼が暴行したのは アスリートＡではなく―”

translation.en: He did it to Maggie Nichols."
translation.ja: “マギー･ニコルズです”

translation.en: Thank you so much for being here.
translation.ja: ありがとうございます

translation.en: [Munford] Watching them...
translation.ja: 皆 お互いに―

translation.en: support each other...
translation.ja: 支え合って…

translation.en: and... and just that momentum of empowerment...
translation.ja: 勇気を与え合って いることが―

translation.en: was incredible.
translation.ja: すばらしかった

translation.en: I'm not gonna look at her. She's gonna make me cry.
translation.ja: 涙が出そう

translation.en: [Povilaitis] I am so honored...
translation.ja: 続いては― ２０１８年１月24日

translation.en: to let you know that the next person you will hear from
translation.ja: ２０１８年１月24日 レイチェル･ デンホランダーです レイチェル･ デンホランダーです レイチェル･ デンホランダーです 審理最終日

translation.en: is Rachael Denhollander.
translation.ja: レイチェル･ デンホランダーです

translation.en: [Denhollander] There are two major purposes in our criminal justice system, Your Honor.
translation.ja: 私たちの訴えには ２つの目的があります

translation.en: The pursuit of justice and the protection of the innocent.
translation.ja: 正義の追求及び 幼い子供の保護です

translation.en: Neither of these purposes can be met if anything less than the maximum available sentence
translation.ja: 司法取引が行われて 減刑されることがあれば

translation.en: under the plea agreement is imposed upon Larry for his crimes.
translation.ja: 目的は果たされません

translation.en: So I ask... how much priority should be placed
translation.ja: 私たちは― 最も重い刑が 科されることを望んでいます

translation.en: on communicating that the fullest weight of the law
translation.ja: 最も重い刑が 科されることを望んでいます

translation.en: will be used to protect another innocent child from the soul-shattering devastation that sexual assault brings?
translation.ja: 性的暴行はとてつもない 苦しみをもたらすのです

translation.en: I submit to you that these children are worth everything.
translation.ja: 尊い子供たちを法の力で―

translation.en: Worth every protection the law can offer.
translation.ja: 守らなければなりません

translation.en: Worth the maximum sentence.
translation.ja: 最も重い罪を

translation.en: [judge] Thank you.
translation.ja: ありがとう

translation.en: [Manly] It's the most incredible thing I've ever seen as a lawyer.
translation.ja: 弁護士として 経験したことのない―

translation.en: It's the most incredible thing I've ever seen in my life.
translation.ja: すばらしい瞬間でした

translation.en: He received two 60-year sentences
translation.ja: 彼が言い渡された刑は―

translation.en: and, uh, you know, the tongue-lashing of the century.
translation.ja: 事実上の終身刑と言えます

translation.en: Now, what people don't realize is that...
translation.ja: 多くの被害者にとって―

translation.en: for almost every one of these girls, this is their first sexual experience.
translation.ja: これが初めての性経験です

translation.en: And when you take the ability to love and express love from somebody
translation.ja: 誰かを愛した時に その愛情表現が 奪われていたとしたら…

translation.en: and take it away or damage it...
translation.ja: その愛情表現が 奪われていたとしたら…

translation.en: it profoundly affects their psyche.
translation.ja: 精神を病んでしまう

translation.en: And, at... at the end of the day... that's really what he did.
translation.ja: 彼のしたことは それくらい罪深いんです

translation.en: [stammers] He stole that part of them.
translation.ja: 彼はそれを奪ってしまった
